I feel like the app is designed quite well, with one small exception; when you are picking the time you want a notification to sound, it shows as 24-hour time, but when you save it, it saves and shows it in "standard" time. Weird design, but not a deal breaker.

Text: Best podoro timer app and I tried a few. It allows you to edit the timer the way you like it and tracks your Pomodoros and the type of work you did. There are 2 features that set it apart from the rest of the timers. 1) if you finish working on something within a Pomodoro set you can click done and continue working on another task or undefined task without the app exiting the timer. 2) it tracks your time worked even if you exit a Pomodoro set early. Lastly, the premium has a 1 off option.

I use it as I'm self employed and it lets me work out how much time I spend on each task as well as helping me to focus solely on each job before I do the next one. The clock also helps stop me from being tempted by social media.

Text: Excellent task management app. I'm able to assign, prioritise, recur & order tasks (using folders/tags). There's some neat analysis of time spent on different tasks too. The to-do list is seamlessly integrated with the Pomodoro timer & you have the options of 'strict mode' & white noise to help you focus. Suggested improvements would be the ability to select an end date for recurring tasks, as well as calendar integration (e.g., Google Calendar).

Text: Firstly, the Poomodoro technique, integrated seamlessly into this tool, has revolutionized the way I approach my tasks. The concept of breaking work into manageable chunks of time, separated by short breaks, is simply brilliant. Text: One year later review: This was the app I was looking for and continue to be happy with my decision to purchase. I am a medical student who wanted a To-do list, organizer, and pomodoro timer to serve as my one stop shop. Focus To-Do works great for that. It's efficient, easy to understand, and minimalist. Text: I love the app. It helps me keep focused by blocking distracting apps, that is why I bought premium. However, I think the app should have some features. First, I hope that one day the sync function of the app between phone and computer works also with the timer (e.g: If I start the timer on the android app, computer should sync and run the same clock on the computer, and vice versa). Text: I have ADHD & find I either don't begin tasks or hypefixate & overfocus on a task, making my anxiety flare once I realize I've been working aggressively for too long without a break. The method is simple & this app facilitates it well! I enjoy the simplicity of the main screen & find that even if I'm still prone to pausing & getting momentarily distracted or working through the break, having a timer with pop-up messages make for a more productive & less stressful or rigid work process!

Text: I'm a subscriber of this app and I really love it's simplicity and sync across devices, but there's one thing that I would change: I suffer from ADD and I'm still trying to traine my focus and discipline, so sometimes I'm not able to focus for an entire Pomodoro. Other times the Pomodoro ends and I'm still "in the zone" so I focus beyond the Pomodoro. That being said the time tracking is not very accurate because when I work more that time is not counted, and if I pause or stop the Pomodoro for an early break I tend to spend more time on the break that I should because there's no timer alerting me that is time to go back to work. Is it possible to add for example two more buttons to the current running Pomodoro? 1 for adding more time, for example a +5m like1 for stop and start counting the break ? I believe that would help a lot for people with attention disorders like ADD and ADHD
text: im a subscriber of this app and i really love its simplicity and sync across devices but theres one thing that i would change i suffer from add and im still trying to traine my focus and discipline so sometimes im not able to focus for an entire pomodoro other times the pomodoro ends and im still in the zone so i focus beyond the pomodoro that being said the time tracking is not very accurate because when i work more that time is not counted and if i pause or stop the pomodoro for an early break i tend to spend more time on the break that i should because theres no timer alerting me that is time to go back to work is it possible to add for example two more buttons to the current running pomodoro for adding more time for example a m like for stop and start counting the break i believe that would help a lot for people with attention disorders like add and adhd

Text: Pomodoro is an extremely useful and user-friendly task organization and productivity tool. The app reminds me of the Charles Hobbs/Day-Timer time management system I used when I worked corporate. (I got a lot accomplished then and I mean A LOT.) I've only just begun using Pomodoro and am already seeing results and feeling increased momentum. It's very satisfying.
